title: Fort Sumter National Monument: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger          Both Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie have Junior Ranger programs available for kids of all ages. Speak with a Ranger or Volunteer at either site to receive your activity booklet and begin your adventure to earn your very own Junior Ranger badge.   Fourth Graders and their families can discover National Park Sites that charge entrance fees, as well as other federal lands, for free!     If you cannot make it to the site, consider becoming a WebRanger. There are many activities you can complete online:  -Learn to Protect the Harbor -Explore the Life of a Civil War Soldier         Junior Ranger earned his 182nd badge at Fort Moultrie in November 2015 NPS/Holder           National Park Service WebRangers Program In WebRangers, you can:  Bring National Park fun to your computer Learn more about your national parks even if you can't visit them Learn about parks before you visit Learn how to care for your parks and your world
